title: Steel Plant To Close With Loss Of 1,700 Jobs
text:

Mon, Sep 28, 2015, 10:57 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 33 mins Steel Plant To Close With Loss Of 1,700 Jobs By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News â€“ 14 minutes ago View Photo 

Up to 1,700 steel workers are to lose their jobs after SSI announced it was closing its Redcar steel plant. 
The company announced it had suspended production at its Teeside site earlier this month as it wrestled with the fallout from a collapse in world steel prices. 
Local MPs and union officials have accused SSI of presiding over a "wall of silence" since the pause in production, which the company had blamed on issues with the supply of materials. 
A union has already raised concerns over whether its members working at the plant would be paid. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) is not the only steelmaker feeling the pressure - with the UK's biggest producer, Tata Steel (BSE: TATASTEEL.BO - news ) , also reeling from the impact of weakening demand and cheap imports amid the economic slowdown in China and other emerging markets. 
The company, which operates two UK blast furnaces at Scunthorpe and Port Talbot, warned in July that job losses - on top of thousands already made since 2007 - were possible. 
The UK steel industry argues it has been made uncompetitive because of high energy costs and the UK tax regime.
